abstract: The bank settled accusations that it had improperly entered secret agreements with bidding agents that gave it a “last look” at bids submitted by its competitors.
snippet: The bank settled accusations that it had improperly entered secret agreements with bidding agents that gave it a “last look” at bids submitted by its competitors.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase reached a $211 million settlement with federal and state authorities on Thursday to resolve allegations that it cheated governments in 31 states by rigging the bidding process for reinvesting the proceeds of dozens of municipal bond transactions.

headline.main: JPMorgan Settles Bond Bid-Rigging Case for $211 Million
headline.print_headline: JPMorgan Settles Bond Bid-Rigging Case for $211 Million

abstract: LivingSocial gave the much-coveted lead underwriter positions for its forthcoming I.P.O. to Deutsche Bank, JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America Merrill Lynch.
snippet: LivingSocial gave the much-coveted lead underwriter positions for its forthcoming I.P.O. to Deutsche Bank, JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America Merrill Lynch.
lead_paragraph: 4:49 p.m. | Updated LivingSocial, the biggest competitor to Groupon in the social-coupon space, has picked three banks to lead its forthcoming initial public offering, people briefed on the matter told DealBook on Friday.

headline.main: LivingSocial Taps 3 Banks to Lead Its I.P.O.

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Evelyn M. Rusli
